faqs.question: Är Costa Blanca en bra plats att köpa fastighet?
faqs.answer: Yes. Costa Blanca demonstrates consistent property appreciation (8% year-on-year), established tourism infrastructure generating reliable rental income, and mature expatriate communities supporting both investor and residential demand. faqs.question: Kan utlänningar köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Yes. Foreign nationals have identical property purchase rights as Spanish citizens. UK and international buyers register Spanish NIE tax numbers, establish Spanish bank accounts, and proceed through standard conveyancing processes. Legal representation and tax consultation ensure compliance with Spanish and origin-country regulations.

faqs.question: Vilka är kostnaderna för att köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically include 6-8% property transfer tax (ITP), 0.4-1.1% notary and registration fees, and legal representation costs (typically 0.5-1% of purchase price). Stamp duty, title insurance, and mortgage arrangement fees apply if financing. Total acquisition costs range 7-10% above purchase price.

faqs.question: Kan jag få ett bolån i Spanien som utlänning?
faqs.answer: Yes. Spanish banks offer mortgages to non-resident foreign purchasers, typically financing 60-70% of property value at competitive rates. Requirements include NIE tax identification, proof of income, and property appraisal. Mortgage processing typically requires 4-6 weeks.

faqs.question: Hur är levnadskostnaderna på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca costs are 20-30% lower than UK equivalents for groceries, dining, and utilities. Supermarket shopping costs €60-80 weekly for individuals, while restaurant meals range €8-15. Utility costs average €80-120 monthly depending on seasonal usage and property size.

faqs.question: How much rental income can I expect from a Finestrat apartment?
faqs.answer: Holiday let rates average €800/week or €3,200/month for 1-bedroom apartments in Cala de Finestrat. Annual gross income potential reaches €35,000-€40,000 depending on occupancy rates (typically 60-75% year-round). Long-term residential lettings yield €600-800 monthly with higher reliability but lower overall returns.

faqs.question: Hur är vädret på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca features Mediterranean climate with 300+ annual sunshine days, average summer temperatures 28-30°C, and mild winters 12-15°C. Rainfall concentrates in autumn/spring with relatively dry summers. Year-round pleasant conditions support extended tourism seasons and outdoor activities.

faqs.question: Is property management available for Finestrat rentals?
faqs.answer: Yes. Established property management companies throughout Finestrat and Benidorm offer comprehensive services including guest booking, cleaning, maintenance, and tax compliance. Management fees typically range 20-30% of rental income, reducing investor operational burden while ensuring consistent property maintenance and guest communication.

faqs.question: What taxes apply to property rental income in Spain?
faqs.answer: Non-resident property owners declare rental income in Spain, subject to 24% withholding tax on gross income. Alternatively, income can be declared under standard progressive taxation (19-45% marginal rates) if formal business registration occurs. Professional management assistance ensures compliance with Spanish tax authority requirements and optimizes tax positioning.
